title: Understanding Economic Development Through Fractal Complexity and Collaborative Democracy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic economic principles, fractal theory, and general understanding of collaborative governance
context.additional_context: Advanced mathematics application course for general citizens, emphasizing analysis of economic systems from a fractal perspective through social learning and collaborative decision-making

learning_goals: It can explain the fractal structure of economic systems in terms of hierarchical consistency and connectivity
It can assess the impact of region-based entrepreneurship and democratic control on socioeconomic welfare through case study analysis
It can present a comparative analysis of fractal complexity metrics and traditional growth indicators (e.g., GDP)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
